data.title: Chosen Name FAQ
data.text:
What is a chosen first name?

A name that a person can designate on District-related unofficial documents and records in place of the person’s legal name and in furtherance of their identity. It is the name that the person uses to identify themselves, and is different from the person’s legal name.

How do I update my chosen name?

To make any changes to your personal information including your chosen first name, simply submit a Student Information Change Form to ccarcom@chabotcollege.edu from your secure ZoneMail email.

Where will my chosen first name be displayed?

Your chosen first name will be displayed on class rosters and your class schedule and in certain online systems including Canvas, CLASS-Web, DegreeWorks, and SARS.

Where will my legal name be displayed?

Your legal name will be displayed on official documents (e.g., official transcripts, financial aid documents, W2/W4, etc.) and in the Student Information System (SIS).

How do I update my legal name?

If you completed a legal name change through the court system and would like to update your information at the College, submit a Student Information Change Form to ccarcom@chabotcollege.edu from your secure ZoneMail email. Be sure to include proof of your legal name change. Proof may consist of a copy of your driver's license, government-issued ID card, marriage certificate, or any other court/government document showing your legal name change.
